alert.note: Alert for Skagit (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 06 at 3:47AM PST until December 06 at 9:42PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Mt. Vernon affecting Skagit County. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skagit River Near Concrete affecting Skagit County. .The upper reaches of the Skagit have crested. The flood crest will move downstream reaching Mount Vernon late this morning. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skagit River near Concrete. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, the Skagit River will flood low areas and sections of roads along the river from Rockport downstream to Sedro Woolley. This level for this location on the Skagit corresponds to a Phase 3 flood in the Skagit County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 AM PST Wednesday the stage was 31.7 feet. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The river crested at 33.8 feet around 8 PM Tuesday. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this afternoon at noon PST.
